modules.description: Creates a request object with specified headers, body, and URL, enabling HTTP post operations. Operates on a custom type `t` that encapsulates request parameters. Used to initiate asynchronous HTTP requests with configured headers and payload.

Provides functions for serializing and deserializing JSON data, with support for custom type conversions. Operates on OCaml's native data types including lists, variants, and records. Used to prepare error reports for transmission to a crash reporting service.

Posts a formatted error entry to a monitoring service using an API key. Processes Raygun_t.entry data structures and returns a handle for further operations. Used to send crash reports and unhandled exceptions with optional customization of the error payload.

Converts a raw backtrace into a structured stacktrace format. Operates on OCaml's `Printexc.raw_backtrace` and produces a typed representation suitable for error reporting. Used to capture and format call stack information for diagnostic purposes.

Provides functions to parse, construct, and manipulate stack trace entries, error details, and request/response data. Works with structured data types including stacktrace_entry lists, error records, and user-defined environments. Used to generate and process diagnostic information for error reporting and debugging.

Provides functions to create and manipulate time values, including converting from Unix timestamps and serializing/deserializing to strings. Operates on the abstract type `t` representing time. Used to generate current time, parse time strings, and convert between time representations.
